nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### üß™ Manual Trigger
Starts the workflow manually. Ideal for testing and debugging purposes.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### üé® Image Generation (OpenAI)
Sends a POST request to the OpenAI `/v1/images/generations` endpoint.

- Uses `gpt-image-1` model
- Generates an image from a given prompt
- Returns a base64-encoded image (`b64_json`)

üìå Output: `data[0].b64_json`

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### üßæ Convert base64 to File
Converts the `b64_json` field into a binary PNG file to use in the next step.

üì§ Output: Binary image under the `data` field

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
### ‚úèÔ∏è Image Editing (OpenAI)
Sends the binary image to OpenAI‚Äôs `/v1/images/edits` endpoint with a descriptive prompt.

- Model: `gpt-image-1`
- Format: `multipart/form-data`
- Requires a real file (not base64)
- Supports optional `mask` input

üì• Input: Binary image from `data`
üì§ Output: Edited image in `b64_json`

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
### üßæ Final Conversion (base64 ‚Üí File)
Converts the edited image (`b64_json`) into a downloadable or previewable PNG file.

üì§ Output: Final binary image

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## üß† Image AI Workflow Overview

This workflow uses OpenAI's image generation and editing APIs with the `gpt-image-1` model.

### üîë Requirements:
- You **must use your own OpenAI API key** from {{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}
- Create a credential in n8n called `OpenAi AIFB account` (or use your own name)

---

### üí∞ Cost Warning:
- This model is **powerful but expensive**.
- Each image costs **$0.020 to $0.190** depending on resolution and type.
- Always monitor your usage via the [OpenAI dashboard]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

---

### üîç Why use `gpt-image-1`?
- Unmatched **semantic control**: you can edit specific parts of images with detailed prompts.
- Supports **multiple input images**, coherent edits, and future multi-modal tasks.
- Editing works with or without a transparency `mask`.

---

### üîß Suggested Nodes to Expand Workflow:
- **Webhook** (trigger via your frontend or app)
- **Telegram / Slack** (prompt image generation from chat)
- **Set node** (inject dynamic prompts or user context)
- **IF / Switch** (change behavior depending on prompt type)
- **Merge** (combine multiple image generations)
- **HTTP Request** (send generated images to external APIs or CMS)

---

### üí° Example Use Cases:
- Marketing teams: generate product visuals on demand
- Designers: edit and re-style illustrations without Photoshop
- E-commerce: dynamic generation of themed mockups
- Content creators: create blog and social thumbnails in bulk

---

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Don't forget to add rate limiting or batch controls if generating large volumes!

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Manualtrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Manualtrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 5 different services: convertToFile, stickyNote, httpRequest, stopAndError, manualTrigger. It contains 17 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 17
- **Node Types**: 5
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking ‚ÄòTest workflow‚Äô**: manualTrigger
- **Edit Image (OpenAI)**: httpRequest
- **Create image call**: httpRequest
- **Convert json binary to File**: convertToFile
- **Convert json binary to File final**: convertToFile
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- ... and 7 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
